data.name: Bullseye!
data.description:
Write an object constructor for darts games!
============================================

You should probably read or refresh your knowledge about the rules your games will be played from:
http://www.flyordie.com/games/help/darts/en/game_rules_501.html

( So 'double out' will be needed. Also, I didn't implement most of the `III. End of the game` section to the tests, so you guys won't have to worry about counting rounds.)

Arguments for the constructor:
------------------------------
- `players`, an  array of player names, eg.:
```javascript
['Huey','Dewey','Louie']
```

- `game`
 - a starting score for each player to begin with, should be 301,501,701 or 901
 - if it isn't one of thoose, set it to 501

Properties and Methods I will test for:
---------------------------------------
- `.points`
 - an object, its keys shall be the player names, and the values should equal the current points of the players
 ```javascript
{'Player1':321, 'Player2':501, 'Player3':501}
```
 

- `.score(player, [value1, value2, value3])`
 - removes points of the player if it isn't a bust

 - values given will ALWAYS be VALID strings, following the notation:
 ```
simple 7    => '7'
simple 20   => '20'
double 20   => 'd20'
triple 20   => 't20'
simple bull => '25'
bullseye    => 'd25'
miss	    => '0'
```

- `.state()`, returns 'Game still in progress'
	or 'Game won by Y'
